page.title: 09The R.S.P.B. 2
page.content: The R.S.P.B. was founded in 1889 as the Fur and Feather Group, primarily to protest against the trade in birds' feathers for the millinery trade. In 1891, it widened its aims and became the Society for the Protection of Birds. Highlights during the early years included the employment of staff in London from 1897, the publication of Christmas Cards in 1898 and the issue of a magazine in 1903. A royal charter was granted in the following year. The original aim of the society, to curb sales of birds' feathers was finally achieved in 1921. During the 1920's the society bought land for reserves, highlighted the problems of oil pollution and warned against the use of toxic chemicals in gardens.
